page.title: 17Recollections-Mrs. Hobbs
page.content: Councillor Mrs.Hobbs has told us a{ history of a few of Blackmore's changes.One of them was the building of the new hall and estates.The old hall was originally two army huts by the roundabout. Blackmore has expanded.In 1961-1971 the populations were respectively 1,507 and 3,268.The new developments in{housing}were Meadow Rise named after a meadow, Orchard Piece,which was an orchard and Woollard Way after Jim Woollard the builder.Later two smaller developments were built,Poplar Close, and Jericho Place . Children went to the 1877 built school until 1966 when a new school was erected. The recreation field was once{allotments}which cost 12\p a year.People continued to rent this land until there were only two allotments left. These were sold and the{recreation field}developed.
